page.title: 09Folly Farm
page.content: The farmer at Folly farm has lived there all his life. His wife has been living there for three years. They have one child and a dog. One hundred and fifty years ago the farm belonged to Christchurch College, Oxford. The farmer has to get up very early in the morning to start work around the farm. He continues work until late at night. The farmhouse is very large in comparison to normal family homes. It is very modern inside and the kitchen has all the usual gadgets and aids. One unusual feature is the large Aga solid fuel boiler and stove which becomes the centre of family life particarly in cold weather.
